history.content: You can repeat for non-credit (though I think this would negatively impact your financial aid status). The other option is to audit the class.

children.subject: You probably need to submit some sort of petition or get permission from an advisor to repeat courses that are not repeatable for credit.  You would be enrolled in the course as a student. Probably either the previous attempt or the new attempt would be considered in calculating your GPA and unit counts. But they won't count both attempt (double counting). You can ask your advisor to clarify this.

Thanks for the response. what does repeating for non-credit exactly mean? Does it mean that my grades won't count, or I won't be registered as an actual student in the course? Would it still count for my units?
Thank you so much for this, I think this gave me a lot of clarity!

A lot of stuff from 61A aren't touched on again in 61B include Scheme, generators, higher order functions, SQL, and a few more probably. The stuff that you'll definitely want to know better and are built on top of in 61B are linked lists, trees, orders of growth, inheritance/OOP, and maybe a few more. I would recommend taking the 3 or so weeks of break left and reviewing those topics to prepare for 61B.

You can also redo 61A without officially doing it, ie not enrolling via CalCentral. All the assignments are posted as ZIPs on the website, all the autograder tests are local, anyone can join the Piazza for the first few weeks, etc. Do what you think will help you learn the material best because I'm presuming you're a first year, and you have plenty of time still.

history.content:
I am an EECS major and took CS61A this fall and got a C+, which was a pass. However, I was always very confused while doing this course, and feel that it would be better if I repeated this course next semester. I want to just make sure that I am clear with all my concepts before proceeding to CS61B. 

However, I noticed that this "course is not repeatable for credit," and I wished to ask if it was possible if I could still take the class next semester even though I passed?
history.subject: Repeating CS61A
